item.title: The Current Knight Problem
item.dc:creator: BigBenBoulevard
item.description:
My two biggest issues with knights are killing people that are possessed, and suiciding yourself when your target gets changed.

The first one makes guarding in possessor games more than worthless, as you will often kill yourself and another BD. At the very least, only killing yourself and not the possessed person (if they are BD) would be a nice chance (but poss might need a little buff to compensate)

The second one is infuriating. You wanted to CS someone, but instead kill yourself, only to later find out the guy you tried to CS wasn’t BD. Even worse in some games because if there is no Psychic, you can’t tell people that the person you tried to CS is NOT confirmed BD.
Much like the Sorc’s ability to snuff out danger, the knight should refrain from CS’ing if their target gets changed.

item.title: The Current Knight Problem
item.dc:creator: Loudo
item.description:
Sacrifice is a trade off and you have to assess whether it’s favorable or not.
You need to evaluate who you are potentially saving (whether they are more or as important as you are or not, since a successful Sacrifice always kills a BD) and who you are potentially killing (e.g. whether there’s Possessor around or not).

Doing nothing can be the more useful option, because trading Knight for Assassin is not usually worth it early on (unless you know you are guarding someone important). Knight becomes more and more powerful as the game progresses, while Assassin can be sacrificed without too many worries at the beginning of the game (especially since your MM is immune to detection early on).

This becomes a whole different story in the mid game when you start getting some claims and so you know who you are guarding. Which is why no evil in their right mind laughs at the Knight.

Knight is a fun class to play because it involves some genuine difficult choices to make. Players who don’t like it probably prefer “instant gratification” classes, where you can basically select a player at random each night and still get something useful out of it no matter what.

Players who aren’t having fun with the Knight perhaps are playing it wrong. You can’t choose to guard every single night and then cry that you always die early… or aren’t useful.

Playing Blue Dragon Killer-types should always involve difficult choices, because you have the most powerful ability in the game (killing) and are part of the majority faction. You can’t have everything.

item.title: The Current Knight Problem
item.dc:creator: Loudo
item.description:
I think the Knight is fine as it is and it’s honestly one of my favorite classes to play as.

Sacrifice should not be spammed, but used with discretion. This is what makes the Knight much more fun to play than the Physician for me: with the Physician, most of the time I feel like I’m on autopilot.

As for Cold Steel, it doesn’t even matter if your target is night immune. The fact you didn’t commit suicide confirms they are not BD, so even if they are immune you can accuse them the following day.
